0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body:
Again nobody is talking about a single look or glance. We’re talking about staring at somebody. Part of your autonomy is feeling safe in your own body, if somebody is staring at you long enough to make you feel unsafe they are absolutely taking it away.

And fine, if you don’t want to get caught up one word autonomy, let’s not use it. Do you really believe you have the right to stare at somebody while they are working out when they don’t want you too? That your desire to look at somebody supersedes their desire to feel safe?

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body: Ok and I’m the one who needs to grow up. You can’t take the high road if you’re just going to belittle the person you’re arguing with. Hope you can see it my way someday, I think I speak for most women when I say we’re tired of having these arguments over and over.

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body:
Really? Your answer is people should leave if they feel unsafe? You place none of the onus on the people being inappropriate? 

This thread was about more than just what the OP was talking about. Maybe you missed it, but the original comment was something along the lines of “women who dress revealing have no right to tell men to stop staring at them because they are inviting it”.

“Choose your words carefully” careful we got a badass over here. Honestly what is your problem?

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body: We have to keep having them because countless men still can’t respect women’s bodies and feel entitled to stare.

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body: The sentiment of “the onus is on women to cover themselves up” and “when women wear revealing clothes they can’t tell me not to look” are rapey statements. These are the same things people say to justify raping women. I’m sorry I had to be the one to tell you this.

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body: And this is why us women have to keep having this conversation we hate. It doesn’t matter what people are wearing. You still have to respect their body and if they don’t want you to stare you don’t stare. It’s not complicated. Glances will happen, but if you’re staring at somebody and making them uncomfortable, that’s not ok, even if they’re wearing an outfit like you described.

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body:
These are literally the most comment things you hear when somebody defends sexual assault. “If she didn’t consent why was she dressing that way? She dressed sexually so she was provoking him! Men can’t control themselves around women who dress sexually!”. It’s the idea that women are to blame for men acting inappropriately, because of the way they dress. 

Sorry the women you are friends with don’t agree with me. Or maybe they are afraid to share their real thoughts with a “friend” like you. Who knows.

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body: So women don’t respect themselves unless they cover up? Who put you in charge of what women need to do to have self respect?

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body: I’m talking about rape because sentiments like the ones you’re expressing are a big part of why rape is normal in our culture. So many people men and women included feel that women are responsible for bad things that happen to them if they dress a certain way. I know that you are not saying rape is ok. But many people use your same logic to excuse these behaviors. When we put the onus on women to dress or act a certain way instead of teaching people to respect others bodies, we build upon a rape culture and make rapists/would be rapists feel more justified in what they are doing. Believing that you’re entitled to stare at somebody or treat somebody how you want if they dress a certain way is a dangerous mindset to have.

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body: How is fair to women to say they need to dress a certain way if they want to feel safe?

0.author: probably-an-asshole-
0.body: Thought we clarified looking versus staring. And it’s fair to tel them not to stare at something when that “something” is another human being Jesus

2.author: Flaky_Bee_2599
2.body:
The claim I am trying to prove is not that there was rigging, is that there was *motive* for rigging. 

I have provided the following examples:

* Patrick Mahomes being a much more prominent figure than Burrow
* Patrick Mahomes being pushed heavily by the NFL
* Patrick Mahomes being pushed heavily by NFL advertisers 

This is called **establishing a motive**. Part of that is getting inside the NFL's mindset, which I have established.

I am also going to establish your motive for denying this: You live in KC and therefore have an interest in ignoring the obvious. 

Football is fun to watch, but ultimately doesn't dictate my life. I'm not gonna cry about it.

2.author: Charming-Milk6765
2.body: I have a motive to rob a bank, but if a bank gets robbed you’ll need more than that to pin anything on me. If all you’re trying to establish is motive then like who cares man. It doesn’t mean anything

2.author: Flaky_Bee_2599
2.body: If you had motive to rob a bank and suddenly got a huge bag full of money, police would suspect and investigate you.

2.author: Charming-Milk6765
2.body: Cope??? My team is in the Super Bowl baby

3.author: cuckhubbie
3.body:
Here is what the “it” refers to when I typed (Pfizer admitted it)in a reply to you in your reply to my *original* post:
“Answer: “Pfizer’s recent acknowledgment of how they are currently using a type of gain of function research to create newer and deadlier strains of the COVID virus in order to prepare more vaccines to use against them.”

Type of gain of function. Mutating a virus into more deadly form, for whatever purpose, *is* the same as the generally accepted definition of *gain of function” regarding research on viral loads. If you disagree with that, then there we go. If you want to be willfully obtuse about common sense and facts. I refuse to carry on here. I did not lie. You tried to twist my statements into one. 

I admit you will no longer find info on that man using google today. Had you done it when the news broke? Yeah you would have. A director of Research for Pfizer has no Google presence(Jordan Walker, btw)? Yeah, ok. That’s believable. Since then and within the 48 hours between Project veritas’ video was released and Pfizer’s statement was released everything got scrubbed by google, YouTube, and all of the other controlled outlets. 

Also Pfizer admitted that they are required by “the regulators” to do these type of “not-calling-it-gain-of-function” and to do them “in secret”. Ok who are these “regulators” and why is it required to be done in secret?  Those are the questions we as a populace need answers to. Pfizer already admitted to doing dangerous and banned viral mutation research. I’m sure their regulators told them to do that so everyone might focus on that instead of why are these regulators requiring secret banned research and who are these unelected people?

3.author: bitofarambler
3.body:
You're blaming others for calling you out on being inaccurate. 

I'm sure you don't feel good about saying the wrong thing, but you did.

You're doubling down on being wrong and claiming that Pfizer is admitting to gain a function research using new terms, while they say the opposite thing in any source you can provide.

Yes, it is strange that a crappy video starring a stranger you magically  believe is a high level executive that zero information, past or present, can be found about. It would almost seem that the video is not legitimate and that that person is in fact not a Pfizer executive.

But since we don't have the data on that definitively yet, we should withhold judgment.

Instead of withholding judgment, you are recklessly twisting the facts and connecting plot points with assumptions.

Your buzzwords and unanswered questions based on assumptions you're slinging must sound fun to you, but destroy your argumentative credibility and have no bearing on gain of function research, antiviral research, or newsworthy breakthroughs. 

You have nothing new to add to the conversation, so instead of adding to the conversation, you're ripping apart the conversation into tiny flutters of ideas, removing the context, and then tying those disconnected ideas together with assumptions.

Made up and unfounded answers might help you with your insecurity, but you're just pulling the wool over your own eyes.

3.author: cuckhubbie
3.body: I said they admitted to performing A TYPE of gain of function. Then when I later said they ADMITTED IT the IT was referring to the original statement I made. FFS, yes it’s is your own fault if you make a very wrong and illogical jump that I said anything differently than I did. I don’t feel bad just because your skill in following a conversation is so lacking. Also, I do feel bad that when you read in black and white that they admit to doing the gain of function research, but call it something else, that is them (to you) not admitting that they are performing gain of function research. That’s like you saying gain of function research is not the same thing when someone calls it evolutionary discovery. It’s all the same research, phrased in a different way to fall on “marks” like you evidently. I’m sure you feel horrible about being shown on a Reddit posting how gullible you are and how easy of a mark you are proving yourself to be. So you keep on doing that, have fun with it, but don’t be so angry about it. Your passive-aggressive replies will go unnoticed.

3.author: bitofarambler
3.body:
I'm so glad you didn't notice my replies but make such desperate efforts to answer them.

My comments on you being irresponsible and cowardly, btw, is direct condemnation, not " passive aggression."

It is not "the same research" In the same way that jumping and piloting a plane are not both flight. While two actions may or may not share similarities, they are different things.

Pfizer did not admit to what you want them to have admitted to. 

You are incorrect.

Watching you flounder now is like watching used toilet paper try to wipe itself.

Gross, but kind of funny.

Keep it up.

5.author: colt707
5.body: So on one fewer game he managed to get 10 more steals(actually believable to a degree) and 29 more blocks. That’s were I’m having a hard time buying it. You get 2 more blocks at home vs on road? That’s a bit fishy. It gets even more fishy when you start pulling up other DPOY candidates and they’re stats are very similar for home vs away. No other player is nearly doubling their block stats during a home game vs away game.

5.author: neosmndrew
5.body:
I'm saying you can't conclude what that post is concluding about jaren Jackson's stats without also looking at every other player in the same conditions (either at Memphis, or at their respective home court). The /r/NBA post is taking a lot of leaps with how statistical analysis work.

And again... It's not at all unheard of for players to straight up just play a lot better at home vs road, especially younger players (which JJJ is) and especially roleplayers (which JJJ is not).

5.author: colt707
5.body: There’s playing better then there’s going from a top 50 player to a top 5 player. While I’ve been waiting for your response I’ve actually been looking at different players split stats. JJJ is the only one I’ve found out of about 20-30 players so far with that kind of jump in stats. I’m not saying that definitely his stats have been inflated but it’s definitely something that raises eyebrows and not in a good way.

5.author: neosmndrew
5.body: it's definetely enough to raise an eye brow. Where i take umbridge with the OP is straight up calling the scorekeeper a fraud (which is irresponsible IMO for a variety of reasons) when there are other explaininations that are not nefarious. There are other reporters who have pointed out similar although less extreme home/away stat differences for players like Jokic.

5.author: colt707
5.body: Fair enough and yes there’s other players with fairly different stats at home vs away but JJJ’s are the most extreme.

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body: Nah, you can’t move the goalpost now..

6.author: got_lukky
6.body: Haha, I understand your fear and insecurity when it comes to talking about the subject you brought up. I hope you can get learn to keep your mouth shut in the future instead of spewing stupidity you can’t back up! Have a good day

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body:
Honestly its cute that you want me to focus on christianity, as thats the easiest one… I don’t even need to talk about how all aspects of the religion were stolen from paganism and other religions, I can destroy your religion with one simple question:

Can your god make a stone so heavy that he cannot lift it?

6.author: got_lukky
6.body:
This is actually one of the simplest of all the “proofs” you could have offered:) God is Omnipotent, creator and law giver of the universe and creation. By this fact alone, logic is from him NOT confining him. In the same way that Jesus was on earth as 100% God and 100% Human, God can create a rock larger than he can lift while still being 100% capable of lifting it. 

Another more complicated version of this apparent paradox is the Trinity; where God is ONE and three simultaneously without the use of modalism. God is a singular monotheistic God, but also a Father separate from His Son and A Spirit who is also separate and distinct. 

In Mark 13:32 Jesus says that only the father knows when The time for Jesus to return in judgment will be, stating specifically that He himself doesn’t know the time. This seems like an issue if you believe that Jesus is 100% God like the Bible states, but if you actually read the Bible, you’ll realize the tension is all fabricated.

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body: So… no answer then?

6.author: got_lukky
6.body: Go read my answer, it’s pretty clear. I can’t help if you can’t read

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body: Oh, I read it… Its just mindless gibberish that amounts to “reality doesn’t matter, nanna nanna boo boo!”

6.author: got_lukky
6.body:
Then I’m not sure I can help you if you’re not willing to have actual conversation. 

Answer one question; would you be convinced and change your mind about Christianity IF I answered your questions exactly like you wanted?

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body:
I was born and raised christian. You have absolutely nothing in your bag of lies and rhetoric that I haven’t heard before. 

Oh, p.s., nobody fell for your lame assertion that you would be open to a reasonable debate. Zealots are never open minded, if they were they wouldn’t be zealots.

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body: Oh, and its cute that you just glossed over the thing i said, about the entirety of christian tradition being ripped off from pagans and other earlier religions.

6.author: got_lukky
6.body:
So it wouldn’t change your mind:) so this is moot point. I’m open to being wrong. 

Let’s go back to the thing you said about me denying reality. Can a man get pregnant?

6.author: got_lukky
6.body: Well you did say “I can destroy your religion with one simple question”. So that seems to intimate that you were wanting to focus on that point:) we can go back to that if you’d like, you just need to be specific in your conversation.

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body:
To be clear if you can prove the existence of God, I will change my mind immediately.  The problem is that you cannot do that.

And no man can’t get pregnant. What the fuck are you even talking about?

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body: Your god cannot make a stone that he cannot lift. Therefore, he is not all powerful. Case closed.

6.author: got_lukky
6.body: So what would be needed to prove God’s existence to you? Can I ask what broke your faith? You said you grew up Christian

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body:
Empirical evidence. 

And I began to question things as soon as I was old enough to realize that the christian account of god describes him like a violent child, and gives no reasonable explanation for the epic suffering some people endure (often as a direct result religion).

6.author: got_lukky
6.body: So, let’s start with a different question, and then another if you’d be willing. Are you currently part of another religion, and what specific instances or events give you the impression of God being a violent and petulant child?

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body:
Things like god having a pack of wolves maul some kids for mocking an old man for being bald. Also the whole “i love you unconditionally, but only under these specific conditions” etc. 

And all religions are bullshit.

6.author: got_lukky
6.body:
None of that makes God not exist though, does it? Your biggest argument against God so far is that you just don’t like him; that’s a far cry from proof he doesn’t exist. 

You can not like God and he still exists, and In fact you can’t dislike a God that doesn’t exist. 

Would you want to talk in more depth about the youths who were killed by bear, or is your mind set on that story?

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body:
Oh, I wasnt postulating evidence for or against god.. i was answering you question. 

Why are you stalling? Evidence or gtfo

6.author: got_lukky
6.body: Where’s your evidence he doesn’t exist? So far you’ve told me that he exists enough to kill people with bears, so I don’t feel like there’s much for me to prove?

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body: That is in fact not what I said at all. …and the fact that your trying to twist everything I say is incredibly tedious and is evidence of your bad faith.

6.author: got_lukky
6.body:
Then clarify your point. Are we discussing the fact that God killed children with a bear (meaning he had to exist to do so) or are we talking about if he exists? You can’t just use both sides of the coin Willy nilly. 

What proves to you that God doesn’t exist?

6.author: got_lukky
6.body: So if you don’t believe the story, then how could it break your faith? And if you have no proof he doesn’t exist, I don’t know why you’d believe he doesn’t. If you could so easily prove he doesn’t exist, I’d come to your side?

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body: So no proof then? And also no integrity?

6.author: got_lukky
6.body:
The burden of proof lies on you as you’re the one asserting premise he doesn’t exist. 

I find it hard to believe you would believe something so strongly with no proof.

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body:
🤦🏼‍♂️

That is literally NEVER how the burden of proof works.

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body: https://www.qcc.cuny.edu/socialsciences/ppecorino/phil_of_religion_text/CHAPTER_5_ARGUMENTS_EXPERIENCE/Burden-of-Proof.htm

6.author: got_lukky
6.body: A majority of all people believe in a God or higher power, therefore you’re making the minority assertion that he doesn’t exist, and therefore you have to prove your point. If you’re in the minority making an argument against the widely accepted norm, you have to prove your point.

6.author: Hater_aider
6.body:
Nope, see the above explanation of why I’m not playing with your logical fallacy. 

Let this post sit as an exhibit for others, of the pointlessness of arguing with people who refuse to acknowledge reality.

6.author: got_lukky
6.body: It’s fine by me if you’d like to leave the conversation. I’m more than willing to go on, but seeing as you’ve not been able to answer any questions or support your argument, I do accept you bowing out.

8.author: orangemaroon25
8.body:
Why is it so impossible for you to comprehend the basic points I'm making? There's nothing difficult in what I have said.

This isn't my "ignorance." You're acting like it's objective knowledge what is or isn't objectionable language, which is just not the case. I said it's not relevant when someone who isn't affected (or doesn't study the issue professionally) makes a claim.

The point to that is that it isn't as simple or objective as you want it to be. That's *why* I want to hear some consensus among the people actually affected.

8.author: Yazman
8.body:
I'm not sure why you take it so personally or get defensive about it. You said that "cina" is a slur in Japan - it isn't. Get it correct. 

Pointing out a typo isn't "discrediting" anything, I'm helping you be more accurate in your representation of a language. Just accept you got it wrong and move on, we don't need these giant fucking chains of comments.

8.author: Yazman

8.author: Yazman

Obviously you've now spent several hours wasting my time with pointless arguing so no, my past few have not been polite.

>Just FYI, that kanji compound is pronounced "shina" in Japanese, not "cina".

But this was a polite comment that you could have just read, fixed your typo, and moved on.

9.author: ShrimpCrackers
9.body:
/u/trying-sanity, you're arguing that Sowell is correct in that slavery was uplifting black people from what you described as a 'famine and poverty stricken Africa' even though you're describing 10 out of like 55 countries, except most of the slaves didn't even come from those areas so you're just wrong.

You do realize Sowell was academically criticized for entirely dismissing the impact of inherited inequality and, of course, ignoring much of history entirely. For example, when America started destroying black neighborhoods, building highways through their neighborhoods, and ensuring they'd be jobless in the 1960s, crime rates soared then and not before. His theory of gang culture arising from rednecks is equally silly too, treating it as memetic identity as if one wears it like a uniform.

The Hoover institute keeps this 95 year old man around because he's a useful tool to 'soften' slavery among Evangelical conservatives of which Sowell himself is one.

11.body:

You said that Greta Thunberg is advocating for policies which would kill millions of people.  

You’re the one trying to fearmonger here, not me.

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
So you’re saying she’s advocating in favor of doing what is necessary to reverse anthropogenic climate change against her will?  🤨

I’m still confused how you think not using fossil fuels will kill millions of people though.  🤔

You’re definitely a troll.

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
Fed what “propaganda” and by whom?  🤨

Are you one of those conspiracy theory nuts?  🤨

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
What’s “[t]he ‘world is ending’ propaganda”?  

Can you prove that her parents were feeding her “propaganda”?  

Nah, you definitely sound like a conspiracy theory nut.  

Do you think that Greta Thunberg’s parents want to kill millions of people?

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
Who said the world is ending due to climate change?  Or that it’s ending in 2030?  🤨. That sounds like a conspiracy theory me.  

That link say nothing about her parents, about any “propaganda”, nor does it say that either Great Thunberg or her parents want to kill millions of people.  You do know that, don’t you?  🤨

So Greta Thunberg and her parents don’t support policies which will kill millions of people?  🤨

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
Nowhere in that link does it say that the world is going to end in 2030.  So you even read the article before posting it?  🤨

You’re falsely claiming that Greta Thunberg and her parents support policies which would kill millions of people.  You’re falsely claiming that the world is going to end in 2030.  You’ve repeatedly referred to an undefined “they”.  You referred to science as “left wing climate extremism”.  You sound like a conspiracy theorist.  

So you think that Greta Thunberg (who is apparently not an autonomous person, but is being controlled by her parents (by remote control? wifi?)) wants policies implemented which would kill millions of people, but at the same time she (I guess by extension her parental puppet masters also) doesn’t want policies which would kill millions of people?  🤨

I am so confused.

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
I read it.  Nowhere does it say that the world is going to end in 2030.  You do know that, don’t you?  🤨

You haven’t though.  🤦‍♂️. You have multiple times now falsely claims that Greta Thunberg and her parents support policies which would kill millions of people.  

When has Greta Thunberg said that world is going to end in 2030?  

Who’s “they”?  The aliens?  The Jews?  The reptilians?  Who?  You have to be specific homeslice or no one is going to know what your talking about.  

Can you prove that Greta Thunberg’s parents are controlling her and her thoughts?  

Based on your comments you don’t appear to support science though.  🤨

Why are you trying to fearmonger people into not supporting the climate movement?  Do you want millions of people to die?

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
Okay.  I’ll continue to acknowledge the fact that people not using fossil fuels won’t kill anyone let alone millions of people.  

I refuse to buy into your unhinged fear mongering conspiracy nonsense.

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body: Does that include you and your fear mongering predictions of mass death if people stop using fossil fuels?

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body: You are fear mongering when you falsely claim that millions of people are going to die of people stop using fossil fuels.

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body: So then you acknowledge the fact that people no longer using fossil fuels won’t cause millions of people to be killed?

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body: So then what is your issue with Greta Thunberg?  🤨

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
You appear to agree with her though based on your last though.  🤨

It sounds like you just want to be outraged for the sake of being outraged.

So you’re saying that if I stop driving a gasoline powered car tomorrow that people will die?  🤨. How?  🤨

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
How so?  🤨

You sound outraged.  

Why do you keep falsely insisting that people will be killed if they stop using fossil fuels?

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body: So then you acknowledge the fact that people won’t be killed if they immediately stop using fossil fuels?

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
So if I stopped driving my car tomorrow, millions of people will die?  🤨.  How?  🤨

Why does the time in which people stop using fossil fuels matter?  Wouldn’t be a good thing if people immediately stopped polluting the atmosphere by burning fossil fuels?  🤨

Why are you trying fearmonger?

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
You said that if people “immediately” stopped burning fossil fuels that “million wills unquestionably die”.  

The sun and the wind aren’t finite.  

Why not invest in green technologies as has been repeatedly been suggested by Greta Thunberg and others so that there is smaller impact on the economy when people stop using fossil fuels?  🤔

You have repeatedly made predictions of mass death if people immediately stopped using fossil fuels.  That’s the literal definition of fearmongering.

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
No it isn’t.  🤨

Do you support the Green New Deal then as it proposes exactly what you appear to support?  

You are fearmongering by falsely claiming that millions of people will be killed if they stopped using fossil fuels.  People are not going to be killed if they stop using fossil fuels.  You do know that, don’t you?  🤨

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
No it isn’t.  🤦‍♂️

The Green New Deal is about reversing climate change and rebuilding the economy so that it is more equitable.  Why are either of those things bad?  

So you don’t think millions of people will be killed if they immediately stopped using fossil fuels?  🤨

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
It’s not a lie.  🤦‍♂️

You are definitely a troll.  

So then you are fearmongering.  Literally no one is going to be killed if they stop using fossil fuels.  Please stop trying to scare people into using fossil fuels.

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
No.  You’re lying.  


You’ve literally said that millions of people will be killed if they immediately stop using fossil fuels.  How is that not fearmongering?  🤨

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body:
So just for clarification, if I immediately stopped using fossil fuels right now, I will be killed?  🤨. By whom?  🤨. For what reason?  🤨

Saying that people are going to die if they immediately stopped using fossil fuels is fearmongering.  You’re not going to scare me into using fossil fuels homeslice.

11.author: Silent-Protection-86
11.body: I hope neither of us are killed for immediately ceasing use of fossil fuels.

12.author: shmip
12.body:
It's so chilling how narcissists can twist the system against us.

It's a feedback loop too, because the people trying to help get damaged somehow (physically/emotionally/etc), lessening or removing their effectiveness, unless they become a full martyr.

It's just exhausting to fight these asshats.

12.author: AGassyGoomy
12.body: So what's a better way to deal with narcissists? Leaving them alone and ignoring them only makes them squawk louder. Is there a third path?

12.author: shmip
12.body:
Yes.

Foster empathy and compassion in your communities. This has at least two effects related to narcissists:

* people will recognize them easier, decreasing their effectiveness
* parents will be more likely to teach empathy and compassion to their children rather than selfishness, decreasing their creation

It's unfortunately a very long term journey, not a straightforward policy we can just enact. I'm pretty sure there's no solution like that.

12.author: AGassyGoomy
12.body: I have no idea how an ordinary person can do that or help, other than being a good person. Setting an example.

12.author: shmip
12.body:
Setting an example, and supporting those that are also setting one. 

Get that attitude out there, and *let people see* you care about it.

The easiest way to keep people down is to divide them so they can't get anything done. Supporting others with *visible* support helps counteract that message of division.

12.author: shmip
12.body:
You're understanding me perfectly. That's the long the journey I meant: fostering goodness in people and communities by being good and showing it.

It'll take effort and willingness in order to defeat division and hate at a societal scale.

12.author: shmip
12.body:
By the way, this very thread is an example!

You're setting one right now for everybody that ends up reading this thread, by seeking collaborative discussion rather than the divisive shit posts that make up most of Reddit.

This attitude can spread, but we have to keep it visible or the shit posters drown out the compassionate exchanges, and everyone gets the impression people suck instead of wanting to help each other.

12.author: AGassyGoomy
12.body: But empathy and compassion have been around for as long as the human race has. So why is there hate in the world?

12.author: shmip
12.body: when the reality is *most* people want to help each other, but the selfish people are louder

12.author: shmip
12.body:
They've existed, but they haven't been prioritized. To the contrary, those attributes have often been regarded as weak.

Power and influence have always been prioritized. No wonder so many people see narcissistic behavior (although they don't label it that) as a positive. That's what civilization has always cared about, seemingly. Kings, gods, "titans of industry", these are the roles we idolize.

The problem isn't that hate exists, it's that hate is *accepted* because we're so used to it. We need to change that attitude of acceptance, and do it with as much visibility as possible to counter the messages of division.

12.author: AGassyGoomy
12.body: So, what can an ordinary person do to change this?

12.author: shmip
12.body:
Keep having these conversations, get as active in your community as you can, help people, and vote

Honestly what you're doing *right now* is awesome

12.author: AGassyGoomy
12.body: ELI5 getting involved in my community. I don't want to get into politics.

12.author: shmip
12.body:
For sure, politics can be very draining.

That's actually a real tactic used by some of them: be so damn annoying people don't even want to engage.

Anyway, you don't need to go to rallies or knock on doors or make phone calls. You just need to do things for your community that *other people* will like and be able to enjoy some benefit.

* join a group that cleans up trash around town
* volunteer at a school
* give away lemonade at a park
* shovel your neighbors driveway or rake their leaves

You're literally just trying to make your community nicer by injecting niceness into it yourself, in a visible way so that others can see your example.

Niceness is a combination of empathy (recognizing another's pain) and compassion (trying to lessen another's pain). That's what we're really lacking in today's social landscape.

12.author: AGassyGoomy
12.body: Where would I find these volunteer groups?

12.author: shmip
12.body:
Your chamber of commerce might have volunteer information, give them a call. Libraries usually have a community bulletin board where people can post notices organizing stuff like this.

Hmm, look and see if your town has a Reddit sub and ask there. Same with facebook.

If you want to get started today, you could just walk around and pick up trash, see if anyone looks like they could use an extra hand or two, even just smiling genuinely at people, stuff like that.

It doesn't need to be an officially organized thing, just start being nice and it'll grow from there.

13.author: AstarteHilzarie
13.body:
That's just the term that was coined for a specific era, it's part of a broader social theory of how changes (progressivism) happen in waves with a kind of ebb and flow. There have definitely been people working for equality all throughout history, but as an overall social movement that really made changes in the western world it really took off and gained traction in the 19th century. The suffragettes fighting for political influence and the right to vote (and helping with working towards abolition,) the right to higher education, and the right to individual autonomy/property ownership and divorce. Once they achieved those things it kind of fizzled out for a while until the next wave when women started fighting for the rights to individualism and sexual autonomy, reproductive rights (even the pill was a battle, not even touching abortion,) workplace rights (sexual harassment, equal opportunities,) along with home life issues like spousal rape, abuse, and further into the issues of divorce and custody. 

There have also been a third and fourth wave since then, third was the "Girl power" 90s era, fighting for recognition as strong, independent, and perfectly capable members of society without needing to conform to the patriarchy's standards and expectations of women. Lots of freedom of expression, celebrating femininity and womanhood, and openness about sexuality. This is where the pundits draw their caricatures of the raging man-hating lesbian feminist with purple hair and combat boots. (Not that that was the whole or even majority, but as always, the most extreme example is the one to use to vilify the whole. And fuck it, sis, rock that purple hair.)

The fourth is where we are now, starting in the 2010s with speaking out about sexual abuse and objectification (think #MeToo - even though people have individually spoken up about abuse and harassment in the past, #MeToo was a WAVE that took over the social conversation for quite a while and saw many people talking openly about these things that they had been scared or ashamed to speak about as individuals before.) There's also a push for overall gender equality, not just for women to be equal to men, but to remove the expectations of gender roles in general - men should be able to care for their children without being asked if they're babysitting. Boys should be able to play with dolls or be told that it's okay to cry and talk about their feelings. Women can be the breadwinner for a perfectly happy and healthy nuclear family, etc.

13.author: blackjackgabbiani
13.body: It's so weird that anybody would STOP pushing for equality. Ideally we never should have had to start. It should have never been acceptable to have inequality and yet it seems like people only recently realized that inequality is bullshit. It's so weird.

13.author: AstarteHilzarie
13.body: Yup, but we have the levels of "equality" that we *do* have because of small incremental changes over history - but we still have a lot of work to do and people angry that we want to do it. I think part of it is so many marginalized groups starting to work together instead of individually in the past. It's not just black people fighting for black rights and women fighting for women's rights and gay people fighting for gay rights etc. The social movement now is more of a mesh of all of it, and working together we're stronger and have a better chance of gaining equality for all. Unfortunately there have always been people who benefit from being above others, and they continue to teach their children that they're better than others.  It wasn't all that long ago that women were considered property of their husbands, black people were *literally* property to be sold, and gay people were beaten and murdered for existing. We've made a lot of progress, but there is still a long way to go and a lot of people upset about every step forward.

13.author: blackjackgabbiani
13.body: But how did people let it get so bad to begin with? We didn't start that way and we didn't end up that way with the snap of a finger.

13.author: AstarteHilzarie
13.body:
I don't think there has ever been a truly egalitarian society. There's always some sort of social hierarchy, based on gender, race, capability, wealth, or just being born in the right family. Religion plays a strong part in cementing those ranks in most cultures, but even as hunter/gatherers I'm sure there were situations where the best hunter was more valued than the weakling, and tribal cultures tend to have some sort of leadership, either a chief kind of figure or a spiritual leader. Once people have a footing they just keep widening the gap. Once some cultures started advancing further than others they started conquering and enslaving them, or at least seeing them as lesser humans while they colonized their land. Women have always been considered weaker and therefore less useful. Their place is to have babies and take care of their husband. There have been some cultures where women were equal or even elevated, but not many.

It's just a facet of nature - even animal groups have hierarchies and social structures. We're self-aware enough that we can realize it's bullshit and move past it, but there have always been people who like having people under them.

13.author: blackjackgabbiani
13.body: yeah but what about valuing people based on their individual merits rather than vagueries? Surely that would make more sense than "all x do this, all y do this"

13.author: AstarteHilzarie
13.body: Sure it would band sense, but then which merits should we value? Which are useless? And I agree with you on how things *should* be, but the answer to why it hasn't been that way is just that those in power like to keep power.

13.author: blackjackgabbiani
13.body: Well yeah it's still a conundrum, but it makes at least more sense than blanket statements. And yeah those in power like to keep power, but surely it should make no difference in whoever is trying to wrest power from them.

14.author: Observante
14.body: That's actually a pretty low rate compared to the US. I didn't know that other causes for long term disab were that low.

14.author: Shevster13
14.body: I definitely get that, but its a last resort kind of thing. 7 years of trying to manage my weight/eating through life style changes and treating (both medications and therapy) hasn't worked. Bariatric surgery would be preferable but its not yet funded her unless you are over 50 and have diabetes. I can't afford to get it done privately and won't for a few years yet.

14.author: Shevster13
14.body:
I suppose it is how you classify them and what you deem long term. It wouldn't come close to those that a physically disabled. It wouldn't even come close to those disabled by injury or car accident. However if you are comparing actual medical conditions, even something as common as a sprained ankle or broken leg doesn't come close. 

I believe that here in NZ, long term means it is expected to last over 6 months. So some of that 200,000 wouldn't have it for long enough, and a lot of them don't have it bad enough to be classified as a disability. But our current leading cause is major depressive disorder which is actively affecting about 1 in 50.

14.author: Observante
14.body:
It's directly comparable to a brain injury, lung injury or heart disorder.

When I got with my neuro because I thought I had a concussion, he said his clinic had doubled the number of patients within months... all these Covid people with the same conditions as concussions and mTBI; limb ataxia, autonomic nervous system dysfunction, sleep/wake cycle disruption, POTS, working and long term memory dysfunction, post-exertional malaise (and other conditions very similar to CFS, a recognized long term disability), neuropathy throughout the body, double vision... it goes on and on.

15.author: Ataginez
15.body:
Because you obviously do. Why else would you go out of your way to tell me I know nothing about the topic when I'm the only one who actually shared an academic paper showing the situation isn't as what reddit makes it out to be?

Heck why would you go to another person's reply and pretend they never talked about downvoting?

Oh right because you're triggered by the fact I pointed out gullible redditors keep mouthing off without any facts to back them up.

Really, keep up with the mental state attacks. It really just shows who are the real unhinged people here desperately clinging to imaginary validation.

15.author: Single_Friendship708
15.body:
Lol you’re not even trying anymore. I care about downvotes because I said you don’t know what you’re talking about even though you had a link???


And somehow commenting in a thread I’ve already made a reply in means I care too much???


You’re not even trying to make sense anymore. I hope this is just a joke because if you’re this serious this is the most pathetic grasping of straws I’ve ever seen.

15.author: Single_Friendship708
15.body: How am I having a meltdown? This is projection at its finest. I guess those downvotes you care so much about really got to you.

15.author: Ataginez
15.body:
Lol, now you're claiming projection when you're the one so obsessed with me.

Really, how else would you call someone so desperate to discredit me that you replied on threads that did not even involve you?

Aside from obsession, the only other explanation is you embarrassingly got caught using alt accounts; and the latter in itself is again only used by people who are actually deranged enough to play multiple personalities to try and seek validation.

15.author: Single_Friendship708
15.body:
It involved me, it was below my reply and you lied that you weren’t the one who brought up downvotes when anyone can scroll up and see that isn’t true. You literally admitted it.

Btw I’m gonna downvote your comments because you care so much about it, lol.

Lol and now I’m an alt? You’re so damn angry you keep grasping at straws

15.author: Ataginez

Indeed enlighten me on why my original comment was wrong to begin with. Provide reputable academic sources please?

(Edit: Also, as further evidence of how unhinged you are, I'd note you were already downvoting my replies to you well before you said so. So this is just you being performative when in reality you were already frothing at the mouth and smashing the downvote button long before you claim you did lol)

15.author: Single_Friendship708

I didn’t even type much, why do I need to answer something again when I literally answered it in the comment you’re replying to.

Calm down a little and breath before making the next angry reply lol.

15.author: Single_Friendship708
15.body:
Academic sources have nothing to do with what I’m saying, idk why you think that is relevant. It’s such a non sequitur. When did I ever mention academic sources? Source that when you get a chance.

And another downvote because you care so much.

15.author: Single_Friendship708
15.body:
Lol my original comment was more in line about you whining about western censorship, I didn’t even read past that drivel. Where is your source on that? Got a source? Source? You need a source

It’s funny you’re pretending you’re not raging like a madman but you keep making up new things I am. You’ve constructed this whole story of who I am purely from me laughing at you

And in any case:

17.body:
It's the ✨ableism✨ and the ✨ hypocrisy ✨ for me 🤣🤮 you're "sorry my life lacks relationships" and you say that "I shouldn't judge people whom I don't even know".... But I'm not the one passing judgement, you're the one judging me without knowing me or my life or the people around me.

The autism pretty much prevents me from having "fantasies" about who ANYONE is. You're spreading misinfo both about two neurodevelopmental conditions I happen to live with as well as about the people involved with this situation.

18.author: nick1295
18.body:
I linked you video and independent testing showing some pretty large flaws with FSD. Furthermore, show me proof MOST of the Autopilot crashes were because users were drunk or intoxicated.

Heres video of all the fails.

https://dawnproject.com/drivers-have-reported-thousands-of-critical-safety-defects-in-teslas-full-self-driving-software/

18.author: soggy_mattress
18.body:
>show me proof MOST of the Autopilot crashes were because users were drunk or intoxicated.

I'm getting pummeled with comments, [here](https://insideevs.com/news/602446/tesla-drunk-driver-blames-autopilot-loses-license/) are a [few](https://www.notebookcheck.net/Drunk-Tesla-driver-tries-to-use-the-old-Autopilot-excuse-after-crashing-into-a-pole.638100.0.html) reports but what I wanted to find was a NHSTA report that showed like 13/16 autopilot crashes they were investigating were either intoxicated or sleeping drivers.

18.author: soggy_mattress
18.body:
I'm very familiar with Dawn Project (owned by a guy whose company builds autonomous car software and sells it to Tesla's competitors). Not exactly unbiased, but whatever let's be critical about it, it's safer that way anyway.  


None of those videos show any accidents like you were originally claiming, though? You said "There have been plenty of accidents while using this Tesla tech", but all these videos show is that it's sometimes sketchy (duh, that's why we're beta testing it..?).  


The child mannequin cracks me up. I feel like they just dressed a 2ft toddler-sized mannequin in the most ridiculous outfit they  could find such that FSD beta couldn't recognize it as a human person. UK and US safety agencies rate Tesla's automatic emergency braking as the best on the market, too, just to make things even more interesting.

18.author: nick1295
18.body: There have been many more than 16. Those are just two random examples that you pulled up, that doesn’t constitute the majority of all crashes from autopilot being due to drunk driving or sleeping.

18.author: nick1295
18.body:
Did I say those videos contained crashes? No, they show the obvious flaws that the software has. They aren’t even from the dawn project, it’s a compilation of videos for testers like you. Those aren’t sketchy, those are life threatening bugs. Veering into the other lane, almost hitting pedestrians, running lights. 

My point with this whole conversation from the beginning is that the software is not in a state where it should be tested on streets with clients as the testers when there are this many bugs. Again, other companies are doing this the proper way and testing with highly trained individuals to work out these kinks but Tesla is just offering as an add on so that you can pay to be the tester and assume liability. You and all the other testers are t highly trained and I am an unwilling participant in this test the minute that you turn FSD on and get on a public road. 

Yes there are disclosures saying you must keep your hands on the wheel at all times and you must be fully focused on the road, but this is be marketed as fully autonomous and being safer than an average driver. I don’t trust you and the average driver to use the level of caution that testing a software like this requires, the level of caution that the highly trained engineers at other companies are using. 

So yeah bottom line is I’m not comfortable with this being available on a public road way nation wide. But I guess I don’t get a right to opt out and I just have to deal with the risk that testers and Tesla are putting me in.

18.author: soggy_mattress
18.body: There were 16 being investigated by NHTSA for Autopilot being at fault, not just 16 total ever, fwiw.

18.author: nick1295
18.body:
They releases this report in June of last year showing 273 crashes with 3 serious injuries and 5 deaths where the Autopilot was engaged (from June 2021 to June 2022). It was leading the group for most crashes by a level 2 advanced driver assistance system. 

https://www.nhtsa.gov/laws-regulations/standing-general-order-crash-reporting



I think this is what your referring to where they reviewed 16 cases. It does not say that 13/16 were due to drivers being asleep or drunk. 

 https://static.nhtsa.gov/odi/inv/2022/INOA-EA22002-3184.PDF

19.author: doff87
19.body: That's... Not how proof works. The burden of proof is on the positive claimant, you and the OP. The poster you're replying to you can't produce evidence that would say something doesn't exist. That's why the concept of God can continue because it's nearly impossible to prove God(s) don't exist.

19.author: HippiesEverywhere
19.body: I don't need to prove that something doesn't exist. It's on the the person claiming something as fact that needs to provide proof of that claim or else it's just opinion.

19.author: HippiesEverywhere
19.body: I just explained how facts work. It's not a fact if it doesn't have evidence to back it up. That's my proof of how it's his opinion. In the definition of the word.

19.author: HippiesEverywhere
19.body: I don't have an opinion here. It is a fact he made claim. It is a fact he has provided nothing to back up his claim. It is a fact that a fact without proof is an opinion. My proof is in the definition of the word fact.

19.author: HippiesEverywhere
19.body: Do you see how circular this is? Your argument doesn't go anywhere. Mine starts and stops with the definition of fact. Anything more you take out of it is just being argumentative for the sake of it.

19.author: HippiesEverywhere
19.body: And they have no proof their claim is true. It is not on me to refute a claim with no evidence.

19.author: HippiesEverywhere
19.body: I didn't refute anything. Can you point me to where I said it was false? An opinion can be true but it needs proof. I'm not the one making the original claim. The original claim is an opinion if there is no data to back it up.

19.author: HippiesEverywhere
19.body: Yes. I said those were opinions and not facts. Opinions can be true.

19.author: HippiesEverywhere
19.body: Right. There's no evidence so at this point it's just an opinion, not a fact. I didn't say his opinion was wrong or false. Just that it's an opinion.

19.author: doff87
19.body: You're way more patient than I'd ever be dude. The willfully ignorant are the worst.

20.author: CreamofTazz
20.body:
Everyone is a free thinker. Literally no one is controlling your thoughts. Everyone is free to think what they want to based on what they're told, and just because for some they don't like what *other* people are choosing to believe they think they aren't free thinkers, yet somehow their belief system is totally based on free thought and has zero outside influence whatsoever.

You're right people who think themselves special for being free thinkers are self-absorbed.

23.author: Doctor_Popeye
23.body:
It sounds kind of like what Jean-Paul Sartre said in his book "Anti-Semite and Jew" just replace anti-semite with YouTuber and Jew with normal people respectively.


>The anti‐Semite has chosen hate because hate is a faith; at the outset he has chosen to devaluate words and reasons. How entirely at ease he feels as a result. How futile and frivolous discussions about the rights of the Jew appear to him. He has placed himself on other ground from the beginning. If out of courtesy he consents for a moment to defend his point of view, he lends himself but does not give himself...


>“Never believe that anti‐Semites are completely unaware of the absurdity of their replies. They know that their remarks are frivolous, open to challenge. But they are amusing themselves, for it is their adversary who is obliged to use words responsibly since he believes in words. The anti‐Semites have the right to play. They even like to play with discourse for, by giving ridiculous reasons, they discredit the seriousness of their interlocutors. They delight in acting in bad faith since they seek not to persuade by sound argument but to intimidate and disconcert. If you press them too closely, they will abruptly fall silent, loftily indicating by some phrase that the time for argument has passed.”

23.author: Doctor_Popeye

26.author: boysetsfire84
26.body:
Yeah the powerful green party with about and below 10% most of the time brainwashed all germans and govern the whole country while in oppostion, sure.

Nuclear is not popular in germany because of tschernobyl and waste storage problems in germany. South germany were quite affected because of the tschernobyl fallout.

If Merkel was so affected by the green propaganda she had the choice to make the change in the way the greens did plan it, she didnt. She closed nuclear and bailed them all out with millions of euros while cripling renewables and other new tech. She did non plan a new energy system or invest in infrastructe or anything else. She did promote NS2, even when the greens were against it, russia did attack georgia and russia did attack ukraine and you wanna paint the greens for that and thats just not true.

Your said the greens are paid russian shills and they did everthing to ensure that we get more and more russian gas. You cant backup anything what you said. I gave you some action like voting against ns2 and more integration with russia and boost renewables .

What for actions they else gonna do, they were in opposition most of the time until last year, and when they got in power all their action was all against russia and is now.

They want more weapons against russia from the beginning, even if thats against their stance they promoted before the attack and they build lng terminals even if they didnt want more gas and were against ns2. On top they were against label the russian gas green.

Where are your arguments other than "merkel had no choice because green propaganda paid by russia" Bring me something specific what the green party pushed so hard that was pro russia, if your only argument is that they dont like nuclear thats another discussion.

In germany only right wing afd tries to promote nuclear, they are against supporting ukraine and were invited to moscow in the past, so wheres your correlation?

26.author: Xicadarksoul
26.body:
> Your said the greens are paid russian shills and they did everthing to ensure that we get more and more russian gas. You cant backup anything what you said. I gave you some action like voting against ns2 and more integration with russia and boost renewables .

Well due to german greens actions.

Maybe they are not paid, its concieveable that they are what tradecraft calls "useful idiot", sabotaging their interest to help an opposing country for free.

> Yeah the powerful green party with about and below 10% most of the time brainwashed all germans and govern the whole country while in oppostion, sure.

You know its possible to agree with policies of multiple parties?

..as such one doesnt need to be "i never vote anything but green" to be convinced that nuclear power must be stopped to combat global warming.

> What for actions they else gonna do, they were in opposition most of the time until last year, and when they got in power all their action was all against russia and is now.

"bUt ThEy wEre iN oPpoSitiOn!" doesnt undo the damage of lies spread in media.

Frankly now that they are in power and continue to sabotage nuclear energy - thus leaving natural gas as long term solution - i don't see green leaders going to Kyiv as anything but damage control for image in media.

> In germany only right wing afd tries to promote nuclear, they are against supporting ukraine and were invited to moscow in the past, so wheres your correlation?

My point is that a supposey green party should by wehemently against dismantling nuclear installations. Especially in the middle of climate crysis.

German greens do everything in their power to excerbate the issue.

One can make a discussion about dismantling nuclear now, but thats a big discussion and no matter on wich side you are, painting it as the greens doing anything in this direction to please the russians is just ridiculus.

26.body:
...it has to do with it because german far right has russian ties and people "but what about neonazis" anytime i dare to criticize german greens.

Noone is forbidden from funding both fringes of the political spectrum. As such, "but Russia has ties to neonazis" tells nothing about greens.

26.author: boysetsfire84
26.body: Oh you sure can critize the afd and the greens independently. I brought it up because your correlation was "greens are against nuclear, so they must be with russia" when partys who are actually with russia are pro nuclear.

26.author: Xicadarksoul
26.body:
Nah.

I didn't mean greens are copying kremlin propaganda 1 to 1. I simply meant that their decidedly "anti-enviromental" policies are most easily explained by russians giving some campaign funds to the group that promotes anti-nuclear sentiment.

...shutting off nuclear plants BEFORE achieving carbon neutrality makes exactly ZERO sense - same is true about campaigning for it for DECADES. 

If you get funds for promoting that nonsense, then that gives an explanation. Not to mention, if i were russiam decision maker, its possibly the easiest way to ensure gas market.

27.author: SadboyDegeberate
27.body:
Answer: Young Thug is at the center of a RICO case, and is believed to be gang leader/shot caller of YSL, which is not just his music label but also allegedly a criminal gang. Young Thug is the main target, and faces charges of murder, witness intimidation, firearm charges and possibly more, and so he is facing life behind bars.

Many other YSL artists and alleged gang members were detained as part of the RICO case, including Gunna. However, Gunna has been freed after taking a plea deal and agreeing to testify should the need arise. He has also adversely affected Young Thugs defense by admitting YSL is in fact, also a criminal gang.

27.author: Datannoyingkid
27.body:
>He has also adversely affected Young Thugs defense by admitting YSL is in fact, also a criminal gang.


To add a note to that, I believe the prosecution and investigators were already aware that YSL was a gang, so it may or may not be relevant, But I'm not a lawyer


Edit: some more info for anyone who wants it. This RICO case has been ~9 years in the making IIRC with YSL. With the beef with a group known as YFN playing a part in the case

27.author: SadboyDegeberate
27.body: I think you're right about them already knowing YSL is a gang, but I think Young Thug and his defence were going to argue that it was only a label, and Gunna's admission may have badly affected that defence. Also I completely forgot about the YFN crew's involvement, thanks for adding that
